title: Android Weekly Issue #638
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Mobile Banking Apps: Secure SDKs Aren’t Enough Is your mobile banking app truly secure? Fragmented security, often caused by relying solely on secure SDKs, leaves apps vulnerable. Our webinar tackles this, offering actionable insights on comprehensive mobile app protection for mobile banking. Register now. Creating Pixel-Perfect UI with Jetpack Compose Mohitsoni shows how to create pixel-perfect UI for any device spec in Jetpack Compose using a library called “aDp.” Jetpack Compose and collectAsLazyPagingItems Dobri Kostadinov examines efficient management of large data sets in Jetpack Compose with LazyColumn. Google Sign-in With Credential Manager Siva Ganesh Kantamani teaches how to authenticate users via Google Sign-in using the latest credential manager API Gemma2 Tutorial: Local LLM Development with Genkit Google introduced Gemma2, an open-source LLM, in June 2024. This article introduces how to make requests to Gemma2 using Firebase Genkit. Writing a Kotlin Multiplatform App from Start to Store Zac Sweers shares some notes from writing a new toy Kotlin Multiplatform app this summer. String vs StringBuffer vs StringBuilder Amit Shekhar teaches about String, StringBuffer, and StringBuilder. Compose Multiplatform and the Native App Future Kevin Galligan makes the case for using Kotlin Multiplatform and Compose Multiplatform to build native apps. Coroutine Testing - Never ending tests & backgroundScope Kaushik Gopal continues the series on writing tests when using Coroutines. Loading Initial Data in LaunchedEffect vs. ViewModel Jaewoong Eum delves into the fascinating discussion on where to load initial data within composable functions and ViewModels. Avoiding unintentional device exclusion in an Android app Mike Yerou shares an example where Merged Manifest view in Android Studio is a powerful tool for diagnosing issues related to the AndroidManifest.xml. Mastering Color Theming in Jetpack Compose Stefano Natali shares some best practices for defining and managing Colors in your Compose app. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code aDp This library is used in jetpack compose to overcome UI differences in different android devices for same code. kopy Nested copies made easy in Kotlin News Diving into the latest from Made by Google Google just dropped our summer episode of #TheAndroidShow, on YouTube and on developer.android.com, where we unpacked all of the goodies coming out of this month’s Made by Google event. Android Studio Koala Feature Drop is Stable! Google announced the stable release of Android Studio Koala Feature Drop (2024.1.2)! KMMBridge 1.0 Release KMMBridge is a tool that helps you publish iOS XCFramework binaries from Kotlin Mutliplatform. This version simplifies the configuration and usage of KMMBridge, with a primary focus on Swift Package Manager (SPM). Announcing the iOS and Android Mobile App Developer Professional Certificate The iOS and Android Mobile App Developer Professional Certificate from IBM provides in-depth training in software engineering fundamentals, user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design, and front-end and back-end development tools Videos & Podcasts Kotlin After 2.0 Learn about the future of Kotlin and its development after the 2.0 version Shaders | Jetpack Compose Tips Dive into the details of using shaders in Jetpack Compose, combined with render effects and how they can be applied to your whole UI. Automatically Make YOUR Code Spotless! Charfaoui Younes shows how to set up and use a Spotless plugin to fix linting and formatting in an Android codebase. All in One Solution for Managing File Downloads in Android - Ketch Lean more about Ketch, an all-in-one solution for managing file downloads in Android. Charty with Himanshu Singh Nicola Corti is joined by Himanshu Singh, author and maintainer of Charty, a chart library entirely written for Jetpack Compose. Now in Android: 109 In this episode, learn more about Android 15 Beta 4, Samsung’s Galaxy Unpacked event, Google Play’s new collection feature, lots of stable AndroidX release, and much more! The latest for developers from #MadebyGoogle In this summer episode of #TheAndroidShow, unpack all of the goodies coming out of this month’s Made by Google event and what you as Android developers need to know! Hot Flows vs. Cold Flows In Kotlin - When to Use What? Philipp Lackner teaches about hot and cold streams with Kotlin Flows. Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with Genkit In this Genkit tutorial, Pavel dives deep into how to implement RAG using Genkit. What's new in Android Studio Koala Everything new in the stable release of Android Studio Koala feature drop, version 2024.1.2 Composition over Inheritance: A Practical Guide Mohamad Rejeb talks about Inheritance and Composition, with practical examples from real projects to see how Composition creates a flexible and reusable codebase.

Is your mobile banking app truly secure? Fragmented security, often caused by relying solely on secure SDKs, leaves apps vulnerable. Our webinar tackles this, offering actionable insights on comprehensive mobile app protection for mobile banking. Register now.

This library is used in jetpack compose to overcome UI differences in different android devices for same code.

Nested copies made easy in Kotlin

Google just dropped our summer episode of #TheAndroidShow, on YouTube and on developer.android.com, where we unpacked all of the goodies coming out of this month’s Made by Google event.

KMMBridge is a tool that helps you publish iOS XCFramework binaries from Kotlin Mutliplatform. This version simplifies the configuration and usage of KMMBridge, with a primary focus on Swift Package Manager (SPM).

Learn about the future of Kotlin and its development after the 2.0 version

Dive into the details of using shaders in Jetpack Compose, combined with render effects and how they can be applied to your whole UI.

Nicola Corti is joined by Himanshu Singh, author and maintainer of Charty, a chart library entirely written for Jetpack Compose.

In this episode, learn more about Android 15 Beta 4, Samsung’s Galaxy Unpacked event, Google Play’s new collection feature, lots of stable AndroidX release, and much more!
